label: 書院
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: Interior setting developed in the late fifteenth century, whose principal features were woven rush floor matting (tatami), paper sliding screens (shōji), a decorative alcove (tokonoma), a built-in desk (shoin), and asymmetrical shelves (chigaidana). Also a style of residential architecture that forms the basis of modern traditional-style Japanese dwellings.　[畳、障子、床の間、書院、違い棚]
